result.execSummary:
The defendant Kassidy E Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Straight time if imposed.  Sentence credit of 3 days was granted.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

No violent contact with parents and Gerald L.  No contact with Margaret M.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by the Agent.  Provide DNA Sample if not yet alreadly previously obtained.  Comply with any other Court Orders.
Case 15CM2286 is dismissed and read in. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
The Court does NOT grant Expunction.

timeConds.notes: Perform 40 hours of Community Service per year for a total of 80 hours.
